timeline.message:
Introduce an EventTypeUpcaster

On the user group somebody asked for my insights into an upcaster which
would only allow for upcasting the event type. As I already had the
rough pseudo code available, I figured an actual implementation wouldn't
 hurt too. To this end an abstract implementation of the
 SingleEventUpcaster should be provided, with abstract function to
 retrieve the expected and upcasted payload type / revision. Other
 methods used during canUpcast and doUpcast should be made protected to
 allow overriding by the user

#event-type-upcaster

Use interface instead of concrete type

The test should utilize IntermediateEventRepresentation objects instead
of InitialEventRepresentation for consistency

#1310

timeline.bodyText: Curious, why an abstract class and not a class where the expectedPayloadType, expectedRevision and their upcast countertypes are passed as constructor parameters?
timeline.author: abuijze

replies.bodyText:
That's,,, a good question. Guess I felt like making an abstract class with abstract methods?
Regardless, I feel a constructor is more sensible too, as it'll require less work from our users. Hence, I'll change this around.
replies.author: smcvb

timeline.message:
Use a constructor instead of abstract methods

The EventTypeUpcaster can be greatly simplified by having a constructor
with the required fields instead of making it an abstract class.

#1310
